extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 navel or honeybell oranges, peeled and split into segments

recipes.title: Winter Fruit Salad #SundaySupper

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Fruit Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. One wine you could try is Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 27 dollars.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: In a medium bowl, stir together lemon, honey, and vanilla.  Add oranges, mango, and blueberries.  Stir until well combined.  Fold in the coconut and ginger.Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight for best flavor.  Salad may be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, stir together lemon, honey, and vanilla.

Add oranges, mango, and blueberries.  Stir until well combined.  Fold in the coconut and ginger.Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight for best flavor.  Salad may be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.
